commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: And so, despite all of your generous support, the student council presidency has gone to Mifune.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: I see, so you lost the election... Well, you might be reeling from the results, but cheer up and keep on fighting!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Thank you very much. However, I think the cards fell just where they should have, so I'm okay.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Wow, you're so strong, Setsuna.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Sad as it is, she won fair-and-square, so there's no point in fighting it. The real problem is her attempts to disband the club.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Indeed. She really is taking it too far.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: All tyrannical despots must one day be struck by the bolt of justice, after all.

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: Bolts of justice aside, what are you going to do about this?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Well...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Excuse me... Oh? And who might you be? You appear to be from another school.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: I can't believe you don't recognize me, the one-and-only super idol, Nico Yazawa. Who the heck are you?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I am the student council president of this school.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: You are? Forgive my delayed introduction. We are Î¼'s, a school idol group from Otonokizaka High School.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: And we are Aqours, a school idol group from Uranohoshi Girls' High School.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Thank you for your courteous introductions. And what brings you all here today?

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: We're here to talk about the School Idol Festival!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: What? Correct me if I'm wrong, but wasn't that canceled after the committee disbanded?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Huh? You know about the School Idol Festival?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I merely caught wind of it. So why is it you are holding a meeting for an event that has been canceled?

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Cause we're not going to let it be canceled, duh! We're going to make sure the show goes on.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: What do you believe you all can do?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Is it so wrong to try?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: It was canceled because there's no need for it, correct? If I'm not mistaken, management withdrew from the event because there's no demand for it, didn't it?

commands.speaker: Rin
commands.line: That's not true at all.

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: Have a look at this.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: What are these, messages? What about them?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: They're messages of support from school idols around the country and offers from people to help out as volunteers.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: All of these messages are?

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: That's right. You get it now? And have a look at all the supportive messages Nijigasaki got.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: There are so many of them...

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: We need the Nijigasaki girls' help to pull off this event! So please don't say that you're abolishing the club!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Even as the student council president, I don't think you have the right to abolish a club without a justifiable reason.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Indeed. You are being far too totalitarian. I would not be surprised if this were to be seen as an abuse of power.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I see. I understand where you're coming from. There does appear to be quite a bit of support for the club.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Then there's no need for us to disband!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: That being said, I am not suggesting we abolish this club without proper reason. The point of being a student is to study. I presume there are no objections to this.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: No, I suppose not.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Yes, to neglect one's studies on account of their club activities would defeat the whole purpose of attending school.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Kasumi? Why are you looking away? And Kanan... What's gotten into you two?

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: You too, Honoka, Nico.

commands.speaker: Everyone
commands.line: Urk!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: If I may be so frank, Kasumi and Karin's grades are lacking in every single subject.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Emma and Rina have horrendous grades in the subjects they struggle with. And Nana, your grades have fallen considerably since you joined this club, haven't they?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: While it shames me to admit it, you're entirely correct.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: It certainly is a problem if your club activities are impacting your grades.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: S-So if we manage to get our grades back up, you'll let us stay together?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: We can talk about that once you've all shown tangible improvements.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Then we'll convince you with our upcoming midterms!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Then you must get 60% or higher in every subject. Otherwise, you will be prohibited from club activities until you do. You must focus on your studies. Understood?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Got it! You better make sure you keep your promise as well! We won't have you saying otherwise if we score 60 or more!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: You have my word. Now, please excuse me.

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: Well, that's great news. 60 isn't so hard! I'm sure you'll all be fine.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Nope, nope, nope, nope! There's no way I can score 60 on everything! *Wail*

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: What do a couple of exam scores matter in the grand scheme of life, anyway?

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: ...If I may ask, what were all of your grades like on your last exams?

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Um, well...

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: You all really scored that poorly?

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Sounds like Mifune was right.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: And it looks like the Nijigasaki girls aren't the only school idols with inadequate grades.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Academic abilities have nothing to do with being school idols!

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: Yeah, what Nico said!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: They most certainly do! Why do you think we're SCHOOL idols?!

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: It appears as though everybody here has quite a bit to think about.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: One thing's for certain, you're all scoring 60 or more on these next tests. Understand?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Whaaat? Us too?

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: What do you think would happen if you got held back? We'd be the laughingstock of the school idol world if our leader had to repeat a year.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: *Whine* Kotori...

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: We'll get through this together, Honoka.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: This is a great opportunity. You can bet I'll be giving you a thorough education!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: All we can do is study our brains out together! While we're at it, let's make it a competition. I think that'll motivate us to study even more.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: You gotta be crazy if you think it's okay to judge people by their grades!

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: You're just saying that because you don't think you can win.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Th-That's not true! All I've gotta do is put a bit of effort in, and it'll be a piece of cake. Yup, a whole cake, even!

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: So you'll show us what you've got?

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Oh, I'll show you! I'll show you I'm not all talk!

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: Such a simpleton.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Then let's make this a battle of the dunces! Whoever scores the worst will be crowned the queen dunce until the next exam.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: I couldn't think of anything worse. If Mito found out that was my nickname, I'd never live it down!

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: This isn't fair at all. I don't know the first thing about studying!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Karin, that's extremely not something to be proud of.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Then why don't we all study together? I'm sure we'll make way more progress if we teach each other.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: That's a wonderful idea. Let's do that. We'll put our minds together and improve our grades!
